loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo
Don Oswaldo es originario de san Martin Jilotepeque, actualmente tiene 34 años de edad y desde hace más de 6 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Tales como siembra de hortalizas, tomate, maíz y frijol. Junto a su esposa han procreado 4 hijos por los cuales luchan diariamente para poder darles estudio y lo que ellos necesitan para vivir dignamente. Agradecen a fape y kiva la confianza que le han brindado y se compromete a seguir siendo responsable en el crédito que solicita. Don Oswaldo solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono químico y orgánico, fungicidas y plaguicidas.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is currently 34 and since more than six years ago he has worked in agriculture. This includes planting vegetables, tomatoes, corn and beans. Together with his wife they have four children, whom they fight for daily so they can give them everything that they need to live decently and so they can study.

They thank FAPE and Kiva for the trust that they have provided and they commit to continue being responsible with the loan that they are applying for. 

Oswaldo is asking for this loan to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizer, fungicides and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Tsevegjav

texts.en: Tsevegjav is 39 years old lives with his wife and two sons in a traditional nomadic yurt called a Ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Myagmarjav helps her husband in their family business of selling organic flour in the local market. His older son Nyamdalai is 16 and a student at the local school, and his younger son Nyambayar is 3 and goes to local kindergarten. Tsevegjav needs to increase his sales to make additional profits to save for his older son's university expense which will soon to be needed. He is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic flour to sell to local customers. Tsevegjav and his family are kind, caring and hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic flour to sell to local customers

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 29-year-old married Palestinian refugee and the father of two children. He has been working in the metal hardware business since 10 years ago. This is his only source for living, and he has to work hard to develop it.

Youssef lives in a Palestinian camp. He works in buying and selling used metals to be melted and sold as raw materials.

This business is very good but needs a high amount of capital to improve and develop it; that's why he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua: to increase his business capital through increasing his amount of metal stock.

Youssef is happy with his business level in the meantime, and he is working hard to expand it in the future, through renting or buying a wide land to spread his metals according to quality, and to keep his customers capable of seeing what they need in a better way.

loans.use: To increase his business capital through increasing his amount of metals stock.

loans.name: Al Tatawor Group

texts.en:
Rabab is the featured borrower of Al Tatawor group.  She got with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they all have certain needs and believe that Al Majmoua is  their only hope to improve.

Rabab is a 61-year-old married mother of two children.  She has been working as a tailor for four years to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's increasing needs.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy thread, needles, and accessories that will improve her output and attract new customers.

Rabab is the lady at the far left in the picture wearing a black and white spotted top. As for the other group members, Sahar is in the middle wearing a blue and grey top, and Sarab is wearing a yellow top at the far right.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and accessories for tailoring

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 35 years old and from the far village of Divisoria of the Isabela Province. 

He has engaged in farming as a business for 10 years. He is a very kind person and alway makes sure he can sustain the needs of his family, with farming as the main source of income. 

In order to improve his yield every cropping, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds for his farm. 

Jaime dreams that he can give a good quality of living to his family through his dedication to his business.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Nazim Ali

texts.en:
Nazim is the age of 45, and is living in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hard worker and gentle person. He is responsible for his four children and old parents as well. 

Nazim is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 1993; now he is very expert and experienced about his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets milk from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day, he takes his buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them baths in the stream. He has to stay the whole day with his buffaloes due to fear of theft. He does not have much time for his family members. Nazim wants to appoint an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford his salary. 

Nazim is taking a second loan, and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of last loan, he has purchased a buffalo and has been benefited from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business and wants to buy another buffalo so that he could increase his monthly income and could appoint an assistant so that he could spend some time with his family. 

Therefore, Nazim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Nazim hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and he will succeed in increasing his monthly income as well.
 
Nazim says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for getting milk.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rogelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell hollow blocks and sand business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Rogelyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, wood and plastic pipe for her business.

Rogelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, wood and plastic pipe for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Flordeliz is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flordeliz has been farming sugarcane for twenty years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Abbas Ali

texts.en:
Abbas is 41, living along his family in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a milk dealer, providing milk in the urban area to milk sellers. He uses his vehicle to carry the milk from one place to another. He has been selling milk for many years, and getting sufficient income to run his house. He has many buffaloes to milk in large quantities, but he has to sell the milk on the same day, otherwise it loses its freshness and he does not have any source for milk preservation.

Now the vehicle for carrying the milk is not working, due to overloading and the rough surface of land in the rural area. His vehicle is totally damaged; it is unable even start. He is renting a vehicle, and he paying a daily fare for renting.  He cannot buy a new vehicle because recently he has purchased two more buffaloes. 

Abbas wants to buy a new vehicle to carry the milk and save on the vehicle rental costs. Therefore, Abbas requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy a vehicle to carry the milk. 

Abbas is very thankful Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan; he seems tension-free now.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to carry the milk.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Residing in the Kien Svay district of Kandal Province, Penh is 65 years old and married. Penh has struggled to make a living through farming rice and growing corn. Penh has been engaged in his business for 34 years and is able to earn up to $9 per day. However, he is able to save only $5 per day after deducting all related expenses. 
Penh has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now, he is applying as a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for his son's university fees for the remaining three years. He hopes that the loan will enable him to keep his son in the university to pursue his degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josefina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, such as soap, eggs, spices, sugar, chips, etc.  She has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as soap, eggs, spices, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is a young farmer, married, with one child.  He has managed a farming business for two years. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for the maintenance and growth of yields on his farm. 

Larry said that he needs to double his efforts towards his farming activities to make sure that he can give a good quality of living for his family by means of farming. He wants to save money for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farming business.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a member of PMPC who has a motorcycle transport business. He is 30 years old and married, with five children. He maintains his membership with PMPC in good standing. 

Now, he has seeking a loan from the cooperative to pay for an additonal second-hand motorcycle. He smiles at seeing his children finish their education.

loans.use: to pay for an addiitonal second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, soap, soft drinks, and other groceries for her general store business.

Herminia successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Herminia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items, like rice, soap, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 44 years old and married. Remedios works very hard in order to support her nephews to send to school.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, sardines, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Remedios would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 61 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Violeta is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en: Hing is 54 years old and married. In her family, consisting of five children, Hing strives to earn a living via a fish-catching business. It is the business that she has had for 20 years. Now, in her group of three, she is the leader. She and her fellow group members are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are seeking the same loan amount of 600,000 riels each. As for Hing, she will spend her loan portion to buy fishing materials to support her fish-catching business. She hopes that she can catch more fishes so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to support her fish-catching business

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 48 years old, lives with her husband in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has dispensed water to local people on behalf of the state water department for five years. Her husband works in the construction field. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam, and felt in order to renovate her Mongolian ger. 

By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will no longer burn much coal for heating.  A drastic decrease in coal consumption has positive effects on environment as fewer pollutants will be released into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, vive con sus padres, trabaja en el Poder Judicial y es alumno  de la Carrera de Derecho en una de las mejores universidades del país. El es una persona con grandes sueños, que lucha por salir adelante y quiere ser el día de mañana un buen profesional.
Esta actualmente en el segundo año, y se destaca por ser una persona que se esfuerza y quiere salir adelante. El al terminar su carrera quiere seguir especializándose y mejorar cada vez mas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad y también para cubrir cualquier gastos imprevistos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Diego's from the city of Curuguaty, where he lives with his parents.  He works in the judiciary and studies law in one of the best universities in the country.  He's a person with big dreams who strives to get ahead and wants to be a good professional in the future.

Diego's currently in his second year and stands out as someone who makes an effort and wants to get ahead.  When he finishes his program he wants to continue to specialize and improve more all the time.

Diego's requesting this loan to invest in paying his university fees as well as to cover some unexpected expenses.

He's grateful for this opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his fees and expenses

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura y la ganadería pues tiene varios ganados que fueron engordados durante tres meses ahora los va vender en alguna feria, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Fortunato, 28, lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in the Colquepata district of the province of Paucartambo.  He's a hardworking and enterprising person who gets his family ahead with the effort he puts into his job.

Fortunato works in agriculture and ranching.  He has several cows that were fattened for three months, and now he's going to sell them at some market.  He was invited to participate in Apu Asangani Communal Bank because he's a responsible person.

Fortunato needs this loan to buy a cow.  He's grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons.  They live in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Amaraa works at a local market at their rental counter selling spare parts during day, and also works cleaning the market after it closes. Their sons attend local school and kindergarten. Gansuh has been running his spare parts business with his wife for years, and he also provides auto repair services and prepares hay to sell to local herders. They are hardworking people who say, "Our only goal is to raise our children to be good people with high educations." They are now planning to purchase a plot of land neighboring their land to start growing organic vegetables for both family use and to sell to local customers.  They are requesting a  loan of 3,000,000 MNT.

loans.use: to start growing organic vegetables for both family use and to sell to local customers

loans.name: Aldabelle

texts.en: Aldabelle is 37 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children. Aldabelle works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to buy more kilos of fish to sell. Aldabelle is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Sheilla Mae

texts.en:
Sheilla Mae is married and a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has raised a variety of crabs to sell for the past nine years. Along with other irregular sources of income, she earns 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. Her husband is also a businessman. 

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and has successfully repaid her previous loans that she used to purchase more seafood to sell. Recently, Sheilla Mae has requested a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more seafood aside from fish and crabs. She hopes to generate more income to be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood aside from fish and crabs.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle resides in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanag del Sur with her family. She is married to a fisherman. She sells the fish that her husband catches in the market. Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 5000 PHP to buy a new fishing net. She never gets tired of doing things to augment their living. She wants to expand her business and to improve the general living condition of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en: A widow mother in rural area of Sangke district, Heam is 60 years old and has ten children, two of whom still count on her. To overcome the family's daily expenses, she has raised chickens for two years as a main source of her income. Heam has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is applying for loan. As the leader, Heam is going to buy more chickens to raise and chicken feeds, and use some portion to build a chicken coop. With this loan she hopes to make a good income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise and chicken feeds

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en: A villager from the Ek Phnom district, Leab is aged 51 years old and a mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. Rice farming and cow raising are the main sources of her family income, which she has been with for 10 years. She can earn about 41,700 KHR per day through her current business to support her family living. This is the fifth loan cycle for Leab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use the loan portion to build a decent house for her family's living. She hopes to have a comfortable home to provide a good standard of living  to her family.

loans.use: To build a decent house for her family's living.

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en:
Dara, 50, lives with her husband and seven children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. Out of her seven children, she still have one is still in school.

To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 25 years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Dara has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Dara wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 25 years old and is living in Casibarag with her family. She has owned and operated a village store for five years and earns PHP 250 average gross profit each day. To have additional income, she is requesting a loan which will serve as additional capital for her business to cater more product offerings like oil, spices, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and more to sell. For her, doing all this will help her ensure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 1,800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Ma. Fe is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Residing in the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Chorn is 61 years old and married. Chorn has struggled to make a living through selling snacks, while her husband is a teacher. Chorn has been engaged in her business for ten years and is able to earn up to KHR (Cambodian Riel) 30,000 per day. However, she is able to save only KHR 16,000 per day after deducting all related expenses. 

Chorn has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower for a loan to pay for her son's university fees. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue his degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees.

loans.name: Tumentsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Tumentsetseg, who is 39 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been running a grocery store since 2011, and she has accumulated a vast amount of experience in the sales business. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their elder son is graduating from his university next year and specializes in the tax system. Their daughter is a first-year student and is working hard to become an aspiring teacher. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 3,500,000 to purchase foodstuffs in large amounts at wholesale prices. As a result, she will be able to run her grocery store without worrying about inventory shortages for some time.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs in large amounts

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 27 años, vive junto a su esposo Edgar y sus dos hijas de 10 y 5 años de edad en su casa propia.
Mónica se dedica a la agricultura y se dedica a cultivar productos tales como  cacao y café orgánico.
Tiene 10 años de experiencia en este rubro y esto le ha permitido ganar mucha experiencia en el campo agrícola en beneficio de su economía familiar. Considera su trabajo muy abnegado ya que puede obtener una producción de calidad gracias al mantenimiento constante que le realiza a sus plantaciones con ayuda de su pareja y contratando a trabajadores de su localidad para tareas complicadas y la cosecha. Para favorecer la obtención de frutos con calidad comercial suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico.
Al finalizar la campaña productiva lleva sus productos hasta los centros de venta ubicados en la ciudad y los vende a buen precio permitiéndole recuperar el dinero que suele invertir con las respectivas ganancias adicionales. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Mónica, 27, lives in her own house with her husband Edgar and her two children, ages 10 and 5.

Mónica makes a living in agriculture growing crops such as cacao and organic coffee.  She has been in this field for 10 years, which has allowed her to get a lot of experience in farming to benefit her family finances.  She considers her job to be very selfless.

She can get a quality crop thanks to the constant maintenance she performs on her farm with her partner and the workers she hires from town for the complicated tasks and the harvest.  She usually fertilizes her crops with organic soil amendments to facilitate getting products of commercial quality.

When the season ends, Mónica takes her crops to the sales centers in the city and sells them at a good price.  This allows her to recover her investment as well as get additional earnings.

This is Mónica's third Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Currently she wants to have 1,000 soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr.Ganbold is 31 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Alimantuya, is 32 years old and runs their family transportation business with her husband. His daughter, Battsetseg, is 13 and attends a local school. 

Ganbold has been working at a local company as a driver for years and has just started a transportation service business back and forth to the Russian border and Selenge province. He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to start a business importing tires from Russia, and selling to local customers using his truck. 

He is a hardworking, creative and responsible man.

loans.use: to start a business importing tires from Russia and selling to local customers using his truck.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang (in the photo), age 31, is a garment worker. She lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two young daughters. Her husband is a construction worker. 
Sokheang is asking for a loan to make new roof of the house where she lives because it’s old and breaking.

loans.use: to repair the roof of the house where she lives.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargal is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Olziisaihan, is 40 years old. He is currently unemployed and works part-time here and there. Her daughter, Onorzul, is 21 and studies at university, and her son, Onobold, is 16 and a senior student at a local secondary school. 

Jargal has been providing a tailoring service business in town for the last seven years in a rental place. She is well-known for her qualified and friendly service. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughrik) to purchase a motor for her sewing machine and inventory to provide her tailoring services. 

She is a hardworking, talented and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for her sewing machine and inventory to provide her tailoring services.

loans.name: Saloma

texts.en: Saloma is a widow.  She has five children who live with her in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  To earn a living, she sells fish in the market and in her community. She borrowed a loan of 6,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy more fish to sell.  She is thankful to GDMPC for giving every small entrepreneur a chance to engage in business.  She hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living, especially for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 42 years old and married with one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a business selling fish in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy, 25, lives with her husband and three children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district in Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for several years, and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. 

Dy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles and completely paid back her loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and send and keep her children in school. Now she is requesting for a loan. Dy is going to her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Davy, 25, is married with two dependent children who are all still small. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and planting cassava. She has been running her business for several years, earning about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day, and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.
 
Davy received her first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund one loan cycle ago, and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, support her family’s needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. With a good business, she is applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR so as to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, who is 27 years old, is married with two children. With his young age as a husband and father, he needs to work hard to sustain the needs of his family, especially in saving enough for the education of his children. He wants the best for his children because, for him, education is the only priceless gift he can give them. 

Because of financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000.  He will use it to buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds for his farming business's maintenance and growth. 

Somehow, Jose also dreams of building a concrete house for his family, thus really doing the best in farming to improve his yield.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Dorjpagam

texts.en: Dorjpagam, 27 years old, lives with her husband in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She began her career by working as a receptionist at a private firm in 2006 and in seven years she became human resources manager. Her husband has the position of project manager and works in a building company. The house the couple lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair as winter approaches. So she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband will make renovations to their house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn much coal for heating. The burning of coal is considered to be the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to the latest research.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria manages her own farm located in the village of Gata Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is also a farmer, and they plant corn and bananas to earn a living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC that she used for farm inputs. Now, she has borrowed a new loan of PHP 25,000 to cover the costs of replanting bananas and fertilizing her farm. 

She expanded her banana farm for it to give more income than other crops. Her plan is to expand her farm to generate more harvest and use the profit to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of replanting bananas and fertilizing her farm

loans.name: Virgelio

texts.en:
Vergelio is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, in the Phillipines.  He is  married and has three children. 

To make a living, Vergelio operates a family member's business providing motor transport services.  Aside from this, he has also managed his own farm, the main source of income of his family. 

In 2012, Vergelio joined GDMPC and had successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to repair his motorcycle. He is requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000 PHP to buy new set of tires for his rented motorcycle. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Marabella

texts.en:
Marabella is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or general store business for more than two years now.

Marabella is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy more merchandise to sell such as soft drinks, feed, canned goods, detergents, seasoning and toiletries. She believes that she will be able to uplift her living conditions with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, feed, canned goods, detergents, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: In Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Elmie runs a service base business providing transportation in the community. Her husband personally operates the tricycle. Elmie successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used in obtaining accessories and a tire. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP because she needs to acquire a tricycle unit. She wants to expand her business to gain more revenue for a better living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to acquire a tricycle unit

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila is 64 years old and married, and she lives at Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. 

To earn a living, she takes in pigs and raises them from her neighborhood. The piglets owners share in the profit upon sale, which is divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  But with a desire to earn more, Panfila has decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Now she has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy piglets and feeds. 

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to keep more sanitary conditions more easily.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

location.town: SINDANGAN-SIPAROK, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORT

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 51 years old, married and has seven children, four of whom in school.

Leonille is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Leonille has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonille would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Phos' Group

texts.en:
Aged 32 years old, Phos is married and her family lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district, Siem Reap province. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She has been farming rice, growing cassava, and raising pigs for almost fourteen years. She is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Phos’s group consists of four members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds and buy more pigs for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds and buy more pigs for raising

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lor's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Lor is 44 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice and cassava, planting to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for 26 years, she is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day.

Lor is a first-cycle client with VisionFund, and she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. 

Lor, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Kadal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Chanthorn is 35 years old and has two children. To make a living, she has been working as a garment factory, while her husband supplements the family's income by growing vegetables and farming rice. 

The current business earns Chanthorn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chanthorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely repaid back her previous loans. The past loans helped her improve her livelihood. She is now requesting for a loan. Chanthorn is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a motorcycle for her family to commute. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Seaghey

texts.en:
Seanghey is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a rural village of the Dambae district. Her daughters are in school. 

Growing cassava is the only main source of Seanghey's family’s income and she has been farming rice on a two-hectare area of farmland for about ten years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about US$9 but she is able to save US$4 each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Seanghey with VisionFund. With the successful past loans, she has been able to keep her two daughters in school. She is now applying for a loan. Seanghey will use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Benediktus

texts.en:
This is the story of Ferdinandus, son of Benediktus:

My favourite lesson is English because I have a dream to go abroad visiting many foreign countries, especially America. I have a little bit of a problem in adaptation with others because most of my friends are using traditional Javanese language. I am a newcomer in Java, and my origin place is Kalimantan/Borneo Island where the language is different from Java Island. But it’s all right; I feel comfort here since actually they are friendly, and the teachers are nice, too. I joined youth church activity called TERAMO. I am able to manage my time well for both of my school and church activities.The financial condition of my family is not good. My parents are poor, and we also have debt to the bank, so they cannot pay my school fees. Now, I am standing near the “Dropout Gate”. Hopefully, to all generous Kiva lenders, I would like to ask you to help me so that I can carry on my study, and at last I can reach the dream of my life. My hometown is Sajiram. It is geographically hilly, rocky and far from a big city. The job of my father is a government officer. His salary per month is between 1 – 3 million rupiahs. The number of children in the family is four, including me. Their ages are 7 years, 11 years, 13 years and 17 years old.If I am given the Kiva loan from lenders, I will spend it to pay my school fees. At school, I learn many lessons, for example, English, computer and networking (my vocational majority), chemistry, math, Indonesian language and so on. I chose the computer and networking because I am interested in computers; computers are unseparated things from the world and human life. Besides that, I want to be a computer expert.After graduation, I want to get a job in a foreign company. (There are) some fun (parts) about school, such as having new friends and sharing each other.
In the picture, Ferdinandus and Benediktus his father.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 47 years old, married, and works hard to help her husband generate additional income.

She has a 'buy and sell' charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Emilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional charcoal for her  business.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is a widow with five children aged 15-28. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. To help meet the needs of her family, she is into making clay pots and clay stoves for a profit. She had this business for 30 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials for pottery-making like clay, pay tuition fees and buy food for her family's consumption. 

Mamerta hopes to keep her business so that her children can finish in their studies.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay, pay tuition fees and buy food for consumption

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en: Remegio is 55 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with four children. He has been fishing for a living for 35 years. He is requesting a loan to repair his boat and pay his children's tuition fees. His income covers food for his family and money for his children’s education. Remegio hopes that in the coming years he will be able to support his children’s schooling until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay for boat repairs and his children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Jen-Jen

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Jen-Jen works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jen-Jen is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to resell to customers. Jen-Jen has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. Joy is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 41 years old, married and has five children and three of whom are still in school. 

Argie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Argie requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Argie has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Argie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, 38, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. One of her children is still in school. To make a living, Neang and her husband have been working in a rubber field. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family's needs. 

Neang has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and send and keep her child in school. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have decent transportation for her family.

loans.use: to buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Dúo Del Balle Group

texts.es:
Dúo del Balle
La señora Inocenta de 77 años, desde hace 28 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado a delante a su familia. 
El sueño de doña  Inocenta es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz y Leña para seguir creciendo con su tortillería, esperando que por medio de ustedes le ayuden con su negocio.
texts.en:
Inocenta, 77, has owned a tortilla stand for 28 years located in Chimaltenango. Because of her efforts, she achieved establishing and improving her home. Through her business she has maintained and moved her family ahead.

Inocenta's dream is to be able to improve the quality of her lime and that of her family through this microcredit that she's applying for from FAPE. With the loan the wants to buy corn and firewood to continue growing with her tortilla stand. She is hoping that through you, you can help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 35 años, vive junto a Félix con quien tiene 3 hijos en su casa propia construida a base de material noble. Virginia se dedica a la agricultura, lleva más de 10 años en este rubro y le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que esta acostumbrada a pasar muchas horas en el campo realizando sus labores cotidianas junto a los trabajadores que contrata para aminorar las tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y en la temporada de cosecha. Comenta que siempre es necesario contar con dinero disponible para la compra de insumos a fin de favorecer la obtención de frutos con una buena calidad comercial, es por ello que suele adquirir sacos de abono orgánico. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con S/.1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Virginia is 35 and lives with Felix, the father of her three children, in a home that they build using new construction materials. Virginia has been a farmer for over a decade and enjoys the work as she's used to spending long hours working in the fields. Virginia works with a crew she that she's hired to help with complicated jobs such as pulling weeds and harvesting crops. 

Virginia observes that it's essential to have funds available to purchase supplies that allow her to harvest high quality commercial produce. This is why she usually purchases bags of organic manure. This is Virginia's fourth loan with Kiva and she will use the 1,000 new soles to purchase organic manure. Virginia is grateful for the financial support she's received to sustain her farm and is committed to making timely payments.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Monhchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Monhchimeg is 27 years old and lives with her husband in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband, Monhbayar, is 27 and provides small construction services to households in town. 

Monhchimeg has been working as a saleswoman for years and gained lot of experience and now just started a clothing sales business in a rental counter near a local market where crowds come. She has good taste in her clothing selection and has regular clients and is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory for her newly started business. She is a hardworking, responsible, and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory for her newly started business

loans.name: 06.03.7 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to resell. Liên is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. Liên is the group leader of the 06.03.7 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2012, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork to resell

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 44 years old, married and has four children. As a farmer, Tito visits his rice field every day for monitoring. He usually gets an income of about PHP (Philippine pesos) 30,000 every harvest season, and that is twice a year. 

He would like to ensure good growth of his crops. That is why he is asking for a loan for maintaining and improving his yield every cropping. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and crude oil for his farming needs. These will help improve his crop production. 

Tito hopes to become a productive farmer and keep improving his crop output. This way, he will continue to provide for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides and crude oil for his farming needs.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio tiene 33 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, habas, trigosy otros productos más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Gregorio, 33, lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province.   He’s a hardworking, enterprising man who supports his family by means of his efforts at work.  His economic activity is agriculture.  He has several parcels of farmland where he grows potatoes, lima beans, wheat and other things.  He’s a responsible person which is why he was invited to join the “Apu Asangani” communal bank.  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy fertilizer.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Joven Gustavo tiene 25  años de edad, vive con su mamá, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08  años a la venta de cerdos vivos y también al destazo de los mismos.
Gustavo sus clientes ya lo conocen y solo le llaman para pedirles los cerdos que necesiten, sus ventas son todos los días de lunes a domingo. 
Gustavo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar de más cerdos y concentrado para engorde de los animales, espera obtener las ganancias suficientes que le permitan mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y así poder seguir creciendo con su negocio. 
Gustavo su sueño seguir poder terminar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Young Gustavo, 25, lives with his mother in her house located in a village in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras.  He’s worked for the last 8 years selling live and butchered pigs.  His customers know Gustavo and they call him to order the pigs they need.  His sales are every day from Monday to Sunday.

Gustavo is asking for the loan to buy more pigs and feed to fatten them up.  He hopes to earn profits enough to improve his and his family’s quality of life a bit and to be able to continue growing with his business.  Gustavo’s dream is to be able to finish his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Garry Lou

texts.en: Garry Lou is married with children. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for six years and receives an income of 5,000 PHP per month, aside from other income that he has earned. He joined GDMPC in 2010. Garry Lou successfully repaid his previous loan that was used for maintenance. Recently, he borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to cover the costs of registration and renewal of licenses. He plans to purchase a new four-wheel vehicle to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of registration and renewal of licenses

loans.name: Andres Jr.

texts.en: Andres Jr. is married with three children and owns and manages a farm while his wife runs a general store to make a living. He always finds ways how to improve his farm and to generate more profit from the farm. He borrowed a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure to improve its harvest. He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams to be successful and hopes to always be happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, for her business inventory.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp, because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Fe is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will be saving money. In addition, she will be helping the environment, and reducing health and accident risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 42 years old and widowed with three children. With three children still in school, Annaliza works very hard to provide for them.

Annaliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. in her general store. Annaliza has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Annaliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, fabric conditioners, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional goods like noodles, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for three years. Analiza earns additional income from raising pigs.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like noodles, sugar, salt and shampoo to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 46 years old and married with four children.  Merlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running her store for 13 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Merlita requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase grocery products for her sari-sari store.

Merlita aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
This is Airene, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  She is a widow and has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Airene operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php19, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Airene dreams to have her own catering services and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Ana Celea

texts.es:
Ana Celea tiene un grado de educación de secundaria cursado hasta el ciclo común básico la cual aprendió a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad sin embargo con ayuda de su esposo tiene mucha experiencia en cultivo de café. Ana Celea tiene 4 hijos la mayor tiene 20 años vive fuera del país y estudio bachillerato en administración de empresas, la segunda tiene 15 años estudia bachillerato en ciencias forestales en otra comunidad, su tercer hija tiene 14 años de edad está cursando ciclo común y la última hija cursa el en quinto grado de primaria en la comunidad que viven. La actividad económica que genera ingresos para su familia es el cultivo de café además de eso es una mujer que también se dedica a la costura y de esa forma también aporta en la economía de su hogar. Fueron sus padres los que le heredaron una pequeña parcela con la que comenzaron a producir y junto a su esposo compraron tierras las cuales desde hace 6 años ellos se han dedicado a cultivar y de los cuales han obtenido mucha experiencia en ese campo y están ubicadas a 15 minutos de su casa de habitación. El café lo venden en la misma comunidad todos los de su hogar se involucran en la actividad ya que desde pequeños les han inculcado ser personas trabajadoras y una familia unida.

Su mayor anhelo es que sus tres hijas menores sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro por lo que día con día lucha en compañía de su esposo para que eso se posible. Hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para mantener sus cultivos sanos y poder al final de la cosecha obtener un buen grano ya que como antes se menciona su economía depende de este rubro para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Celea finished middle school and learned to work in agriculture when she was very young. In addition, her husband has helped her acquire great experience in coffee growing. Ana Celea has four children: the eldest is 20 years old, lives abroad and finished high school with a specialization in management; the second oldest is 15 years old and studies forest sciences in a secondary school located in a different community. Her third daughter is 14 years old and is in middle-school. Her youngest daughter is in fifth grade, in a local school.

Coffee growing is the family’s main economic activity. In addition, Ana Celea also works with sewing activities, which represents an additional income for the family. Her parents left her a small piece of land located 15 minutes away from where they live and in which, together with her husband, she started producing coffee six years ago. They have learned a lot from this work. They sell the coffee locally. Every member in the family is involved and they were taught to work hard and remain together since they were very young.

Her biggest dream is that her younger daughters can become professionals and can have a better future; this is why she and her husband fight to make it come true. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies to keep their crops in good health and obtain a good product when the harvesting time comes. This is something important for the family, as their wellbeing depends on that.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a worker at a construction company. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by running a food stall. 

She started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying food and furniture for her food stall in order to better serve her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Agvaandorj

texts.en:
Mr. Agvaandorj, who is 57 years old, lives with his wife and their youngest daughter in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2012, after his retirement, he began to work as a sentry at a specialized inspection authority because his retirement pension was insufficient to cover his family's living expenses. His wife is also retired and gets a state pension. Their youngest daughter studies at university and will graduate next year.

Mr. Agvaandorj is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase fiberglass and felt in order to insulate his ger as winter approaches. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without fearing the upcoming winter.

loans.use: to purchase fiberglass and felt for his ger

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita 46 años de edad casada originaria de una de las comarcas del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país con un hijo aun bajo su responsabilidad, es propietaria de pulperia donde vende productos de consumo para el hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, productos congelados, cosméticos, chinería entre otros al igual que también tiene otros tipos de negocio como: venta de cerdos, molino y unas mesas de billares ubicados en su casa de habitación, ya son varios años de dedicarse a estos negocios los cuales le ha ayudado para salir adelante junto con  sus hijos, no es primer crédito que Maria ha tenido, los cuales ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, cumple con el pago de sus cuotas en tiempo y forma posee clientes fijos y eventuales al igual que ella da al crédito y al contado los cuales recupera semanal y quincenalmente. Con el financiamiento invertirá en la compra de productos de consumo para asi ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económico
texts.en:
María Margarita, 46, is married and from one of the districts in Chinandega municipality, a zone located in the west of the country.  She has a dependent son and owns a grocery store where she sells basic staple items for the home like basic grains, snacks, frozen goods, cosmetics and low-cost knick-knacks, among others.  She also has other types of businesses like: pig sales, milling service and pool tables located at home.  She’s been in these businesses for several years now and they’ve helped her get ahead with her children.

This isn’t her first loan.  She’s shown herself to be a responsible person who makes her payments as scheduled.  She has regular customers she sells to on credit and for cash; she collects payments weekly and bi-weekly.

She will use the loan to buy basic consumer goods to provide better customer service.  María is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they offer to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gladys Morena

texts.es: Doña Gladys de 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 12 años de edad,  doña Gladys  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona responsable, honrada, humilde, trabajadora y muy reconocida en el lugar donde comercializa sus productos, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Gladys solicita un crédito para invertirla compra de mas mercadería como naranjas, limones, verduras, etc. y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Gladys is 45 years old.  She lives in her own home with her life companion and their 12-year-old daughter.  Doña Gladys has been selling fruits and vegetables for several years at the market near her home.  She is a responsible, honest, humble, and hardworking person who is well-known in the place where she sells her products.  As a result, she has been able to cover many of her family’s expenses.  

Doña Gladys is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as oranges, lemons, vegetables, and other items.  This will enable her to improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oranges, lemons, vegetables, and other produce in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pave her floor and to buy cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Yura

texts.en:
Yura is 68 years old and lives with his wife and his son's family in a rented apartment in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife, Tseyenhorloo, is 59 and retired. She stays home and takes care of her husband and their 33-year-old son, Bathuyag, who works at a local drilling company. Yura's daughter-in-law stays home and takes care of his grandson.

Yura has had a business providing taxi services in the city since 2003, and he is an experienced driver. His wife is planning to start a business selling vitamins and other nutrients in order to increase the family's income, since they have a newborn in the family. Yura is asking for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to let his wife start her vitamin and nutrient sales business at a rented counter of a market. Yura's family is happy and hardworking.

loans.use: to let his wife start a business selling vitamins and nutrients.

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN CRISTOBAL DE APARQUILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría las chanchos y cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,por medio de estos pequeño negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los chanchos y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chanchos y cuyes.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo después la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “San Cristóbal de Aparquilla” communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

María’s 51-years-old, married and mother of six children.  She works in her business raising animals to sell.  She has guinea pigs and pigs that she raises and fattens up to then sell in various street markets.  She supports her children by means of this small business.  She likes to move ahead in her free time and her dream is to own a locale in which to sell her pigs and guinea pigs.  She’s asking for the loan to buy piglets and guinea pigs.  She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The other members sell pigs, sell chicha [corn-based traditional beverage], run grocery store and work in agriculture.

The members in the photo attached to the group photo took their photo afterwards because they asked permission due to work.

loans.use: to buy piglets and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa tiene  26 años de edad,  tiene una hija que dependen de ella es madre soltera, la actividad a que se dedica  es la Venta de piñatas, confites, juguetes y todo para la celebración de fiestas de cumpleaños. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas de 15 meses con la que ha permitido satisfacer los gastos en el hogar, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de piñatas, dulcería, galletas, papelitos, etc. y abarrotería ya que diversificara su negocio ya que la ubicación es acta para dicha actividades comerciales.
Doña Rosa espera esta inversión le genere los ingresos necesarios para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia también espera tener la suficiente mercadería para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Doña Rosa su sueños es contar con su propio local más grande y exclusivo para dichas actividades comerciales,  gracias al apoyo que reciba de Prisma de Honduras le contribuirá a subir un peldaño en el logro de sus sueños
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old and has a daughter who depends on her as she is a single mother.  Her business is selling piñatas, sweets, toys, and all kinds of items for birthday celebrations.  

Rosa has worked in this field for the past 15 months and it has allowed her to meet household expenses.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase piñatas, sweets, cookies, paper products, etc, as well as assorted grocery items since this will diversify her business and since her location is excellent for such commercial activity.

Rosa hopes that this investment will generate the income necessary to improve the quality of life of her family a bit, and also she hopes to have sufficient merchandise in order to offer her customers better service.

Rosa's dream is to have her own larger and exclusive store for her commercial activity.  Thanks to the support that she receives from Kiva field partner Prisma of Honduras this will help her to climb one more step towards achieving her great dreams.

loans.use: to purchase piñatas, sweets, cookies, paper products, etc.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio is 59 years old, married, and lives in the village of Iguig. 

To make a living, Nicasio plants and harvests rice for food consumption and sale to traders. He also hires additional laborers who help him in planting and harvesting rice crops. Nicasio is taking out a loan in order to meet all the needed inputs in farming and labor costs, UREA(fertilizers), and insecticides for his farming. He had been a farmer for many years. 

He aims to increase his crop production every harvest season. Nicasio is also hoping to become a successful farmer someday and somehow provide a better life to his family through his farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (UREA-fertilizers, insecticides) to use in farming.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo  para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia y cubrir el pago del préstamo; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Julio needs to take out a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue farming basic grains.  This investment will help him to purchase agricultural supplies such as: compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other items. 
Julio's previous loan allowed him to strengthen his business.  With his earnings, he has been able to support his family and cover the loan repayment.  It is because of him that his financial situation and his family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other items.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has six children who are in school.

Christina has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items such as hair conditioners, soft drinks, milk, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Christina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as hair conditioners, soft drinks, milk, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to care for his coffee plants

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma de 50 años de edad, una mujer luchadora y emprendedora quien no tuvo estudios; ya que sus padres no la quisieron enviar a estudiar y se dedico a ayudarles en los quehaceres del hogar, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 30, 18, 21, 16 y 24 años. 

Ella posee un negocio de herrería en el cual elabora ganchos para colgar hamacas, ya tiene más de 20 años de experiencia este trabajo, lo aprendió con un amigo que lo visitaba seguido y de ver decidió poner su propio negocio, iniciando con una hermana y ahora, ya con su negocio propio en el que su hijo le ayuda y lo tiene instalado en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar hierro, que se necesita para la elaboración de los gachos, el carbón para el horno donde caliente el hierro a temperaturas altas para moldearlo, de esta forma abastecerá a mas clientes que ella tiene y sus ingresos familiares mejoraran y su familia estará mas confortable  

A futuro la señora, tiene el deseo de ver a una de sus hijas graduadas como todas unas profesionales universitarias; ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad y sus otras hijas, ya no quisieron seguir estudiando actualmente solo tiene a una en los estudios y es su sueño ver graduarse de la universidad, además ver de que forma mejora el lugar donde trabaja y comprar  mas materiales de los que tiene para comenzar a ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Irma, 50, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who never attended school because her parents didn’t want to send her to school and she dedicated herself to help them with the household chores.  She’s a single mother of five children who are 30, 18, 21, 16 and 24 years of age.

She has a blacksmith business where she manufactures hooks to hang hammocks.  She has more than 20 years’ experience in this line of work.  She learned it from a friend who visited often and she decided to start her own business starting it with her sister.  Now she has a business of her own and her son helps her with it; it’s home-based.
