The loan she’s requesting is to buy iron that’s needed to make the hooks and charcoal for the oven where the iron is heated to high temperatures in order to mold it.  In this way, she’ll be able to supply more customers she has and her family income will increase and her family will be more comfortable.

In future, she wants to see one of her daughters graduate as a university professional since she never had that opportunity.  Her other two daughters didn’t choose to continue studying.  At present she only has one in school and her dream is to see her graduate university.  She’d also like to find a way to improve the place where she works and to buy more materials than what she has now to start expanding it.

loans.use: to buy iron and charcoal.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely joven de 23 años, es soltera, cuenta con 5 años de trabajar como impulsadora de ventas; vive con la mamá, el papá y un hermano.
Ella fue capacitada para desempeñar el trabajo que actualmente tiene, camina 20 minutos desde su casa de habitación hacia su lugar de trabaja labora de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., los días de semana y los fines de semana de 7:00 a.m. a 12:00 p.m.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para cancelar un crédito de su padre y dice que se va a ahorrar más ya que el pago que hace en la otra institución es mayor. Ella piensa en seguir estudiando, una licenciatura en leyes, con los ingresos que su trabajo genera compra todo lo necesario para ella y la cuota de crédito.
texts.en:
Areley, a young woman of 23, is single. She has been working as a sales promoter for 5 years. She lives with her mother, father and one brother. She was trained to perform the job that she currently holds. She walks 20 minutes from her home to her workplace and works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. on weekdays and 7:00 am to 12: 00 pm on weekends.

The loan that she is seeking is to pay off a loan for her father and she says that he will save more since the payment that he makes in the other institution is higher. She plans to continue studying for a law degree. With the income that she earns from her job she buys everything that she will need for this and the loan payments.

loans.use: to repay a loan for her father.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijas,  de las cuales dos ya se encuentran casadas y las otras dos aun están estudiando,  actualmente  viven en el Sector Maxeño Santo Tomas la Unión, Suchitepequez.
El es un hombre trabajador ya que cada día  se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que es sastre, eligió esta actividad porque le gusta ya que puede elaborar diferentes prendas de vestir. Por lo que ahora lleva 20 años trabajando en este oficio.
A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables,  por lo que de esta manera  está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial  y así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio y así poder tener un local en donde pueda exhibir las diferentes prendas que elabora.
texts.en:
Luis, 48, is married living with his four daughters two of which are already married and two are still in school.  They live in the Maxeño Santo Tomas, La Unión, Suchitepequez.

He’s a hardworking man who strives daily to move his family forward.  He comments that he’s a tailor and chose this activity because he likes it because he’s able to manufacture various types of articles of clothing.  He’s been in this line of work for 20 years.

He earns acceptable income and profits from what he does and is asking for a 6,000 Quetzal loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to offer better customer service.  His dream is to generate higher profits in his business in order to have a locale in which to display the various clothes he makes.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 31 years old, married to Maurine, and blessed with two children aged 10 and 5 years. Sammy is a farmer  as well as a livestock-trader,he also does motorcycle transport when he is not committed in his farm business he has done for the last 13 years. He earns a monthly income of about Kshs. 110,000.


Sammy has requested a loan of Kshs 80,000 to invest in his livestock business by purchasing more dairy cows for rearing and selling at a profit. He will plough back the  anticipated profits to expand his businesses.Sammy also owns a motorcycle which helps provide additional income through transportation.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 36 years old, married and blessed with 4 children aged between 10 and 2 years.  He supports a family of 5 members. Mike owns a retail shop that has been in operation for a period of seven years, earning an income of KES 13,500 monthly.

With his 2nd loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, Mike wishes to purchase stock of sugar, tea leaves, washing detergents, among other items, as a way of expanding his shop for sales.  The anticipated income amount will be used for future saving and secure a plot of land for his family.

His dream is to ensure his business earns profits as well as provide for his family.

loans.use: buy stocks for his store

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbayar, 28 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a technician in the television industry since 2008. His wife is an accountant at a private firm, and his mother-in-law has retired from work and receives a state pension. 

Mr. Uuganbayar is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a closet, a chest of drawers, and a dining table. By doing so, his family's living condition will become more comfortable and give him enthusiasm to work harder. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a closet, a chest of drawers and a dining table

loans.name: Arianna Yolibeth

texts.es: Arianna es originaria de la ciudad Estelí. Es comerciante y se dedica a brindar el servicio de Cyber desde hace mucho tiempo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, quien le ha brindado su ayuda desde que empezó esta actividad. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito, ya que pudo comprar repuestos y equipos para cumplir las necesidad de sus clientes, logrando aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar una impresora nueva y mantenimiento de los equipos cómputos, con el fin de mejorar su servicio. Tiene como expectativa expandir su negocio y ser líder en el mercado.
texts.en:
Arianna's from the city of Estelí.  She's a merchant who has made a living offering computer services for a long time.  She has the support of her father, who has helped her since she began this job.

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she was able to buy parts and equipment to meet her customers' needs.  She managed to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

She is requesting this new loan to buy a new printer and to maintain her computer equipment so she can improve her service.  Her hope is to expand her business and be a leader in the market.

loans.use: to buy a printer and to maintain her computer equipment

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support her family. Elvie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elvie has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Elvie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions such as milk, sugar, tea, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Arlen Xilonem

texts.es: Arlen es originaria de la ciudad Estelí, casada, madre de un hijo. Es comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace mucho tiempo. Inicio esta actividad vendiendo comida, poco a poco fue invirtiendo en productos de uso diario y lo cual le ayudo a crecer como comerciante. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, café, jugos, gaseosas, pasta dental, jabón, papel higiénico, entre otros. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para su negocio, ya que podrá  diversificar sus productos y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Se considera una persona con mucha expectativa, que lucha día a día para obtener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en: Arlen is from the city of Estelí.  She’s married and mother of one son.  She’s a merchant.  She’s been in the grocery selling business for a long time.  She started the activity selling food and gradually invested in daily use items that helped her grow as a merchant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy products like: rice, sugar, beans, oil, snacks, coffee, juice, soft-drinks, toothpaste, soap, toilet paper, etc.  She figures that the loan will be of much use to her for her business because she’ll be able to diversify her inventory and offer a wider variety to her customers.  She’s considered to be a person of good potential who strives daily to attain better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene  49 años, esta casada con  Alberto y vive junto a el en su casa construida a base de adobe. Hace más de 10 años se dedica junto a Alberto a la producción de cacao orgánico. Lo agradable de su trabajo son las ganancias que percibe al expender su producción en los centro de venta de su localidad para el cual tienen actualmente dificultades en cuanto al transporte, esperando adquirir un vehiculo para el futuro. A manera de mejorar sus ingresos tiene en mente ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao puesto que sus parcelas poseen tierras muy fértiles y llegan a producir mazorcas de muy buen calidad. Uno de sus planes a futuro es la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de productos comestibles para generar ingresos paralelos a sus actividades agrícolas. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49, is married to Alberto.  They live together in their adobe house.

Rosa has worked with Alberto growing organic cacao for more than 10 years.  What's pleasant about her job is the profit she earns when she sells her crop in the sales center in her town.  With regard to that, she currently have transportation problems, so she hope to acquire a vehicle in the future.

To improve her income Rosa has in mind expanding her cacao fields.  Her land is very fertile and produces very high quality corn.  One of her plans for the future is to open a grocery store to earn an income alongside her farming activities. 

This is Rosa's third Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead and she promises to make her payments punctually.

She wants to have 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Ylaria

texts.es: Ylaria de 28 años, es  viuda y madre de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Ylaria se dedica a la agricultura  y cuenta con sus propios terrenos de cultivo en donde siembra cacao orgánicos, barbasco; entre otros. Cuenta con mas de 10 años de experiencia en este rubro. En esta ocasión ya finalizada la época de cosecha algo desmotivada narra que existen algunas enfermedades propios de sus plantaciones que arruina los frutos maduros y por consiguiente  una gran parte de su producción obligando a darle más atención al tema de mantenimiento en sus plantaciones. A puertas de empezar la temporada de mantenimiento es muy necesario contar con abono orgánico. Este es el cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y plantas de almácigo.
texts.en:
Ylaria, 28, is a widow and mother of two children who live with her in a house built of adobe.  Ylaria works in agriculture and owns her own farmland where she grows organic cocoa beans and barbasco [an evergreen bush], among others.  She has more than 10 years’ experience in this line of work.

On this occasion, having completed the harvest season somewhat disillusioned because plant illnesses particular to her crops have destroyed the ripe fruit and much of her crop yield, she’s has pay more attention to plant maintenance.  

About to start the maintenance phase she must be able to have organic manure.  This is her fourth Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure and plant seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and plant seedlings.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.en:
Casimiro is 45 years old and married with four kids. As a farmer, he wants his farming business to do well and to have a plentiful harvest next cropping season. 

Casimiro is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for the labor cost incurred during the planting time. In addition to this, he will also buy fertilizers for the growth of his crops. He hopes to gradually improve his farming so that as his four children enter school, he may fulfill his dream of supporting them as they exercise their right to education.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost incurred during the planting time, as well as to buy fertilizers for the growth of his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and iPad to improve her education.

loans.name: Alexis Margarita

texts.en:
For the last couple of years, Margarita has owned and operated Enigma Boutique. The Laredo, Texas, storefront holds women’s apparel and accessories including dresses, tops, scarves, hats, watches, sweaters, pants and shorts that always change with the season and are sold in all styles, and hide the flaws of any body shape.

In an elegant, clean store, Margarita offers high-class shopping with a low-price inventory. And it is Margarita’s stylistic eye for selection that keeps her customers returning. Her eye for style and ability to match accessories to her merchandise has kept her business open for two years, but currently, she has needed more inventory to offer her loyal customers.

Margarita visited a business adviser at Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit microlender, who assisted her through the loan application that allowed her to purchase inventory. To keep up with what Margarita has in store, or for more information, view her Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Enigma-Boutique/142212182508259/.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
This is Vangie, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, a driver, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Vangie maintains a direct sales business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct sales brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the margin is the profit that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Vangie hopes to have a good life and dreams of expanding her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Enrique Antonio

texts.es: Enrique, estudia la carrera de Lic. en Administración de Empresas, trabaja en la misma universidad donde estudia, desempaña el cargo de asistente de administración. Enrique ya está en la etapa final de su carrera y necesita entrar al curso de titulación por lo que solicita este crédito para poder pagarlo. Para él es muy importante su desarrollo profesional porque así podrá aspirar a un puesto de acorde a su formacion.
texts.en: Enrique is studying an undergraduate degree in Business Administration. He works as an administrative assistant in the same university where he studies. He is in the final period of his studies, and he needs to take a course to finalize and qualify his degree. Therefore, he has applied for a loan to pay for this course. His professional development is very important to him, as he will then be able to aspire to a position in line with his degree.

loans.use: to pay for a course to qualify his university degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: help her husband purchase a large amount of prepared planks and transport them to town for sale to local customers

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicanod al negocio de agricultura,al socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y habas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura.La socia solcita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working in agriculture.  She has a field where she grows corn, potatoes and lima beans.  She works from 8am until 6pm and has been in this business 7 years.  She does very well.  Her dream is to expand the agriculture business.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farmland.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from the general store. Josefina is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetables vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetables vending business.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Doña Daysi es originaria de la ciudad Estelí, casada y madre de familia. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio profesional de belleza desde hace mucho tiempo. Es una persona que ama su trabajo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación tiene la oportunidad de embellecer a las personas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: planchas de cabello, secadoras, tintes, cremas entre otros. Agradece a Kiva y MiCredito la oportunidad que brindan a los comerciantes, ya que pueden cumplir con sus metas a través de esta ayuda económica. Su plan futuro es tener su propia academia de belleza donde pueda instruir a personas que les apasione esta profesión.
texts.en: Daysi’s from the city of Estelí.  She’s married and a mother.  She has worked as a professional hair stylist for a long time.  She’s a person who loves her work and thanks to her effort and dedication she’s able to make people beautiful.  She’s asking for the loan to buy hair straightening combs, dryers, dye and cream, among others.  She thanks Kiva and MiCredito for the opportunity provided merchants because they are able to reach their goals thanks to this economic help.  Her future plan is to open her own beauty school to teach those who are passionate about this profession.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and tools.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 63 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y para pagar a los peones, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Benedicta, 63, lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province.  Her main economic activity is agriculture.  She grows wheat, barley, potatoes, tubers, vegetables and other things.  She’s a responsible person which is why she was invited to join “Apu Asangani” communal bank.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy manure and to pay the laborers.  She’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Marina tiene 40 años de edad  y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganadería y agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez también se dedica a la venta de leche a los clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra y alimentos para sus ganados.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank located in Anta Province, Cusco Department.  Luz Marina, 40, has a spouse and alternates her daily activities with agriculture and animal husbandry.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily.  At the same time she works selling milk her customers request.   She’s a responsible, hardworking person and this is how she supports her family.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fertilizer for her field and feed for her cattle.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fields and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores,la socia cria cuyes los hace engordar y crer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas,ella tiene un puesto en un kiosko escolar,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y alimento para los cuyes.

La socia se siente agradecida con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cupoast establecidas.
texts.en: She continues in the business of raising small animals.  She raises guinea pigs.  She cares for them and fattens them up and then sells them in various street markets.  She also works in the business of selling snacks.  She has a stand in a school kiosk.  She’s able to move her children forward by means of these businesses.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her animals.  She’s asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Pati Ibed

texts.es:
La socia Pati Ibed se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de maiz la socia lleva a vender a diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Pati Ibed makes a living by buying and selling corn. She goes out to make sales in various places. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has been in this business for eight years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a business place where she can sell corn. She has applied for a loan to buy corn.

Pati Ibed is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.

La socia Rosa  es casada y tiene 6 hijos, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganaderia, producion y venta de leche y crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a estas actividades los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a cada actividad que realiza, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus vacas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” communal bank in the district of Tambo Real in the province of Anta in Cusco, Peru.

Rosa is married with six children. She continues to make a living by raising livestock, producing and selling milk, and raising small animals. She has had these business activities for some time, and they are going well thanks to the hard work she puts into every one of her activities every day. She is a responsible person, which is how she provides for her family.

She has applied for a loan to buy feed for her cows.

Rosa is grateful for this loan and she promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycad (see photo) transport business in the Philippines.

Fe has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycad.

Fe has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her tricycad

loans.name: Lodina

texts.en:
Lodina works hard to support her family. Lodina is married and has a native hat making business in the Philippines.

Lodina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business.

Lodina has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lodina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her native hat-making business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like hot dogs, pasta, spices, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 15 years. Lilibeth earns more income from general store.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like hot dogs, pasta, spices, meat, etc.

loans.name: Heav

texts.en:
Heav is 70 years old and lives in a small village in Siem Reap province. He is married, with two children, and works as a rice farmer. Only one of his children, still single, helps him in farming activities; his wife passed away a few years ago. Aside from farming, he is also involved in raising pigs to generate additional income.

As of now, he has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice crop and to buy piglets for raising. 

His dream is to improve his business and home. He thanks you for the loan, which will allow him to maintain a good production of his crop and pigs and thereby generate more income for his family. 

He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop and to buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Presentación tiene 47 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganaderia, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez también se dedica a la venta de leche a los clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Presentación, 47, is married and has five children. She belongs to the San Bartolome de Tambo Real communal bank in the province of Anta, Cusco Department. She alternates her daily activities working as a cattle rancher. She has many years experience working in this business, which is going well thanks to her determination every day. She also sells milk to customers who request it. Presentación is responsible and enterprising, which has helped her move her family forward. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy a cow. She is grateful for the loan provided and she promises to make the payments that have been established.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia works hard to support her family. Emilia is married and has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines.

Emilia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Emilia has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Florecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo crédito Nuevo Florecer está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes son trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que su objetivo en común es el de lograr la estabilidad de sus hogares y de sus familias, laboran en diferentes fuentes de empleo y a pesar de todas sus dificultades nunca pierden su buen sentido del humor. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por ser cuna de grandes artistas y deportistas, esta bañada por 4 ríos y su centro histórico cuenta la historia de esta ciudad.


Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de muebles de oficina, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su madre pero independientes.

Doña Ruth es profesional en la rama de la costura ya que estudio para ello, labora desde su casa en la confección todo tipo de prendas de vestir, lleva 3 años con su negocio y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras y otros materiales de costura que le hacen falta. 

Su meta es agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Florecer loan group is comprised of eight female members and one male member who all work very hard to meet their common goal, which is to achieve stable homes for their families. They work in various sectors and despite the difficulties, they are never in a bad mood. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is known for being the birthplace of great artists and athletes. The city has four rivers and its historical center tells the city's history.

One of the members is Ruth, 34. She is married and has two children ages nine and seven. Both her children study in the city's school. Her husband works in an office furniture factory. They don't have their own home so they live in her mother's house, but independently.

Ruth is a sewing professional, since she studied for this career. She works as a dressmaker from home, making all kinds of dresses. She has been in this business for three years and works Monday through Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She will invest her loan money into buying fabric, thread, scissors, and other sewing materials that she needs.

Her goal is to expander her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, scissors, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  Lorna is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, etc., for her general store.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, etc.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadeth has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from selling native foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a single woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 37 years old.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. Lorna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda works hard to support her family. Minda is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Minda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Minda has been in this business for two years now.

Minda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Caciana

texts.es:
La socia Caciana se dedica al negocio de produccion y venta de queso,leche y yogurt,la socia lleva a diferentes lugares y los vende,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy biem,le sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los lacteos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche,yogurt y queso.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Caciana sells cheese, milk and yogurt. She travels to different places and sells her products. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has had her business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her dairy products. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, yogurt and cheese. 

This member is happy with the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: purchase milk, yogurt and cheese.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 30 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rochel is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Rochel has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Mary Ann earns additional income from her general store. She is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, etc., for her food vending business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La Sra. Marcelina, continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos en las ferias que se realizan los fines de semana, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada
texts.en:
This member of the communal bank is part of the "San Martin de Zurite" group.  This bank is located in the town of Zurite, in the Anta province of the department of Cusco.

Marcelina continues to make a living in agriculture and cattle raising.  She is responsible and persevering.  She wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.  Marcelina raises her animals to sell them later at the weekend markets.  With this work, she is getting ahead with her family.

Marcelina is applying for a loan to buy feed for her animals.

She is grateful for this loan and promises to be disciplined as she makes her repayments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes, la socia cría a pollos y cuyes, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animales.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to make a living buying and selling young animals.  She is responsible and persevering.  She wants to be able to continue working and thus continue to support her family.  This member of the communal bank raises the young animals to sell later to her customers.  She is raising chickens and guinea pigs and, with this work, is helping her family to get ahead.

The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: Jose Rolando de 31 años de edad, es un joven humilde que trabaja para una empresa privada desempeñando el cargo de auxiliar de ventas y también estudia la carrera de Ing. en Sistemas. Actualmente necesita solventar los aranceles pendientes de la universidad y pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera. Es por eso que Jose Rolando solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder pagar este curso tan importante para su desarrollo personal para en un futuro trabajar en su carrera.
texts.en: Jose Rolando is 31 years old.  He is a humble young man and works for a private company as a sales assistant.  He is also studying computer programming.  Jose currently needs to pay university fees and for his degree.  For this reason he is applying for a loan in order to pay for this course which is so important for his personal development and so that he can work in his chosen field

loans.use: to pay fees and for his degree title.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro tiene 35 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi hace 1 año. Inicio esta actividad con dinero propio junto al apoyo de su hermano y padre, quien le cedió la línea de taxi para que trabajase de manera independiente. Solicita el crédito para cancelar el pago de su vehículo ya que tiene un saldo pendiente. Se considera una persona con muchos deseos de superación que con esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación podrá adquirir mayores ingresos, para el bienestar de su familia y del mismo. Estima que al adquirir el crédito podrá tener tranquilidad para trabajar, ya que tendrá un plazo de pagos mensuales para la cancelación del préstamo que  Kiva y MiCredito le otorgase.
texts.en: Pedro is 35 years old and originally from the city of Estelí.  He has been making a living as a taxi driver for a year.  He started this work with his own money, and with the support of his brother and his father, who gave him the taxi line so that he could work independently.  Pedro is applying for this loan in order to pay off his vehicle.  Pedro says that he has a lot of desires to get ahead and thinks that with effort, hard-work, and dedication he can earn a higher income for his and his family's income.  He believes that with this loan he can work in peace as he will have a monthly repayment plan for the Kiva and MiCredito loan.

loans.use: to pay off his vehicle.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Enhbat, is currently attending OT, a big mining project of Mongolia, training for organic vegetable growing. Her children attend local school and kindergarten. Lhamsuren has been running her grocery store business for years and now she is planning to grow organic vegetables in their plot of land with her husband and sell them at her store. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables, seeds and soil to make her new business idea happen. Lhamsuren is an optimistic, welcoming and hard-working lady.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables, seeds and soil to make her new business idea happen

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos is from Chrang Chamreh Muoy of Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She is 53 years old and lives in a family of six members. She has a position in a local market, selling beef with her spouse from a rented booth. She is friendly and sells meats at a reasonable price, which is the reason why she can attract more customers to buy her products. Having been in this business for years, she is able to make a net profit of 5.60 US dollars per day.

Sos has requested a loan amounting to 600 US dollars for the purchase of meat to stabilize her vending business. Her goal is to make a stable income; otherwise her income is hardly enough to cover her living costs. She plans to use some of the profit she expects to generate as a result of the loan for her daily needs and will save the rest for the future expansion of her business. She thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase meat to stabilize her vending business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a parent of two children who are in school, Paz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Paz is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through the past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 37 years old and married with six children. With six children currently in school, Narfe works very hard to provide for them.

Narfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store including soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, and shampoo.

Narfe has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, etc. 

Narfe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store including soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, and shampoo.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling feed in the Philippines.  She earns additional income from a general store and by farming rice and corn. Tessie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of feed to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de ganaderia y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de quesos y yogurt,la socia a los ganados los ahce crecer y luego los vende,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos,yogures y quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works in ranching and also cheese and yogurt selling. She finishes cattle and then sells them. She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She wants to get ahead this way. Her dream is to have her own business site where she could sell cheese and yogurt. She is applying for this loan to buy livestock and livestock feed. 

She's happy for the loan and she's committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the business tricycle unit.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Samuel, who is a butcher, and she supports a family of three children, ages 19, 16 and 7 years old.

She has a general store where she sells all manner of items, ranging from beauty products to food stuff and household goods such as utensils. This business has been in operation for the past year. To enable her to stock it even more, she has applied for her second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and she plans to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Margaret hopes to own a supermarket and have better living standards.

loans.use: to expand her general shop by stocking it with buckets, cosmetics and drums.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen resides in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She  is married and has five school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer and Belen operates a service-based business providing parlor services in the local community. Belen has been involved in her business for eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan that was used in her business' improvement. Belen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase parlor accessories, hair medicine and treatment. She plans to use the profit generated from the parlor to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase parlor accessories, hair medicine and treatment.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She is 60 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer and Estella helps to operate a banana production farm. She has been engaged in her business for 14 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estella joined GDMPC. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. She is requesting a loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish and other sea-foods to sell in her food stall.

Melanie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melanie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling roasted whole chicken in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional chicken and spices for her business.

Catalina has been in this business for 30 years now.

Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional chicken and spices for her business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 60 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Lydia, who is a farmer, and he has eight children ages 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22 and 18 years old.

He has been running his butcher shop for the past 13 years. To assist him to be in constant supply of meat to his customers, he has applied for his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy goats and sheep for slaughter.

Jackson's income per month is KES 30,000, and he intends to use the profits from his expanded business for paying school fees for his children who are in college.

In the future, he hopes to open several butcher shops and buy a plot on which he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to slaughter, then sell the meat from his butchery.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Rosemarie has been in this business for 3 years now.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand hopes to achieve abundant harvest to help pay for the education of his children in order for them to earn a degree, which is the only legacy he could pass on to them when he returns to dust. 

Ferdinand is 49 years old, a father to his five children, three of whom attend college. His wife also cooks and sells food for snacks and daily meals to supplement the income derived from farming. 

Ferdinand owns and manages a 1.5 hectare of rice field where he plants and harvests rice to sell. Ferdinand is now borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides he needs to till and maintain his farm for a better yield. This will help ensure the good nutrition of his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides to till and maintain his farm for a better yield.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 31-years-old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Estela is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Estela has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 50 years old.

Susana has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Susana has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en:
Ma. Niña is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Niña is 34 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Ma. Niña has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. Ma. Niña requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment of her business.

Ma. Niña has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Niña would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment of her business.

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Merry is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Merry requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Merry has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merry would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 67 years old and from Olkalou, Kenya. He is married to a woman named Elizabeth.  He has seven children aged 35, 32, 22, 22, 18, 10 and 8 years old.

He is a farmer who practices mixed farming and has been into this business for the past 35 years.  He has applied for a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy planting seeds, fertilizers and herbicides so as to be more productive in his farming activities. He is also going to use some of this money to pay laborers who will be cultivating on his farm.

His monthly income right now is 40,000 Kenyan shilling and he hopes to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to improve his farming activities by buying seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and hiring laborers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell to her customers.

Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Erlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Nusrat. She is married and has four daughters and three sons; she is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

In 1995, her husband established a bushiness of clothes selling in his nearby town. Now, his young children are growing and their needs as well. With the rapid increase in the necessities of family, he wants to grow his business also. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family, so he wants to grow his current business but does not have sufficient money.

Because of that, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy a variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell.

Nusrat hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the enterprise of her husband and in her family as well.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is involved in transport business and agriculture, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay the school fees for his children. His dream is to educate his children up to the university, and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them.

Poor roads, unpredictable weather changes, and high fuel prices are his major challenges. His dreams are to construct a permanent house and expand his farming activities. 

Charles intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to sell.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old from Olkalou, Kenya.  He is married to Diana who is a farmer, and they have four children aged 16, 11, 9 and 3 years old.

He is in the business of mixed farming which he has practiced for the past ten years and has enabled him be more productive. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET Ltd which he is going to use to purchase a cow for his farm.

His monthly income right now is 20,000 Kenyan shillings and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay his loan and to educate his children.

Paul hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land and be happy with his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his farm.

loans.name: Uwemacho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwakakoko est âgée de 46 ans et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est secrétaire du groupe d’affaire « Uwe Macho ». Son mari est auditeur financier auprès d'une entreprise hôtelière. La cliente est  entrepreneur et propriétaire  d’un cafeteria (petit restaurant). Elle démarra son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 3 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 3 sacs de pomme de terre,  2 bidons d’huile végétale, 50 kg de riz, les poissons, la viande, le lait, etc. Dans le futur, elle compte accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir,  soigner ses enfants. Elle adresse ses remerciements à Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
The client Mwakakoko is 46 years old and mother of 10 children, all attending school. She is the secretary of the "Uwe Macho" business group. Her husband is a financial auditor with a hotel company.

The client is an entrepreneur and owner of a cafeteria (small restaurant). She started her business with her own funds received from her husband. She has been running the business for the past three years.

She will use this new loan to buy three bags of potatoes, two cans of vegetable oil, 50 kg of rice, fish, meat, milk, etc..

In the future, she intends to increase her working capital, and also educate, feed, and take care of her children. She wishes to thank Hekima for its support to non-bankable women.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of potatoes, 2 cans of vegetable oil, 50 kg of rice, fish, meat, milk, etc..

loans.name: Vecelina

texts.en:
Vecelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.  Vecelina has been in this business for 6 years now.

Vecelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more scrap to sell for her buy and sell scrap materials business.

Lucrecia has been in this business for two years. Lucrecia earns more income from her general store.

Lucrecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with ten children, three of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Erlinda has been in this business for 6 years.

Erlinda runs a buy-and-sell bag business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional assorted bags to sell.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase assorted bags to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 43 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mishal

texts.en:
Mishal is a 23-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child.  She is living with her husband and parents. She does not do any job; she stays at home and looks after her child and parents.

Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about four years. During this time, he has been driving his rickshaw continuously. Now he needs to maintain the rickshaw's important parts.
 
Her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he knows that BRAC Pakistan provides loans with easy terms and conditions. He sent his wife to BRAC's nearby branch for her first loan with Kiva. She hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make the payments on time.

Mishal requested a loan from Kiva. Her husband will use this amount to buy spare parts for the vehicle, such as tires, bolts, headlights, and tubes and to pay for the maintenance of his auto rickshaw.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson, a father of three children, is 42 years old and lives in Divisoria. He needed financial assistance in order to get an additional labor force for his farming business. Therefore, he requested from lenders a loan to pay for the labor costs and to buy fertilizer and seeds. He wants the best for his family so he is working hard for them through farming. Furthermore, his dream to see his three children finish their studies in college and somehow be employed in decent jobs is an ultimate goal for Nelson, so he is very patient and sacrifices a lot in his farming to earn enough income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 30 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Florita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from electronic load retailing.

Florita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his eldest son by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. He teaches his son how to convince the customers and how to tackle a hyper customer. His son helps his father after attending school.  
Shabana is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care.
Shabana wants to grow the business of her husband so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakista, so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and she in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, soap, detergent, biscuits, bubbles, candies etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy grain, millet, peanuts...to store and resell later

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for six years now.

Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman 28 years old, married with 3 children. He lives in Duanguican,Tudela, Philippines.
Herman is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other corn crops, chemicals such as corn rootworm protection, seed falters, insecticidal viruses, etc.
Herman has been a member of PMPC for a month.  He hopes to use the additional income to prepare for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other corn crops chemicals such as corn rootworm protection, seed falters and insecticidal virus.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and her children are in school.

Janice has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase raw materials such as shells and nylon threads for her business.

Janice has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as shells and nylon threads for her business

loans.name: Ayaba Louise's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Ayaba Louise (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 57 ans. Ayaba Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Louise est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Ayaoba. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Ayaba Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ces enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Ayaba Louise et son mari. Pour ce faire Ayaba Louise vend divers produits (huile et maïs) à son domicile depuis dix sept ans. Ayaba Louise s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ayaba Louise s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The person representing the group is named Ayaba Louise (the one with the raised hand on the photo); she is 57 years old. 

Ayaba Louise did not attend school. She is married to a driver named Ayaoba. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and three of whom are their dependents. Ayaba Louise lives with her ​​husband and children. She shares the household expenses with her husband.

To accomplish this Ayaba Louise has been selling various products (corn oil) from her home for the past seventeen years. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to strengthen her business Ayaba Louise joins other members of her group in seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy corn and vegetable oil

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 63 years old and married with eleven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, soap, eggs, bread, canned goods, shampoo and groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, soap, eggs, bread, canned goods, shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d‘habillement, de chaussure, de savon, céréales des produits cosmétiques  tubercules des tissus et d’articles divers.                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe  BENKADI, sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.                  
La cliente FATOUMATA  première debout à droite est vendeuse d’habillement. Elle compte acheter 8 rouleaux de pagnes chez les grossistes à Barouéli. Elle effectuera ses ventes quotidiennement à Barouéli et à Kinda au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité d’habillement.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group of women, all married, are on average 35 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the city of Barouéli, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell clothing, shoes, soap, cereal, cosmetics, tubers, fabrics and various items. The BENKADI group of women are on their fifteenth group loan.

Member FATOUMATA, the first person standing on the right, sells clothing. She plans to buy eight rolls of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) from wholesalers in Barouéli.

She conducts her daily sales in Barouéli for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay her contributions to social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in the clothing business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe NAFAMA, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli,  Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de la restauration, d’habillement, de l’essence.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe  NAFAMA, sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire. La cliente TENIN assise en deuxième position à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 250kg de riz et des condiments chez les grossistes à Barouéli pour sa gargote. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement dans sa gargote à Barouéli au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The NAFAMA group of women, all married, are on average 35 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the city of Barouéli, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell tubers, clothing, gasoline, and offer catering. The NAFAMA group of women are on their twentieth group loan.

Member TENIN is sitting second from the left. She will buy 250 kg of rice and condiments from wholesalers in Barouéli for her tavern. She conducts her sales daily in her Barouéli tavern, for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay her contributions to social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in the restaurant business.

loans.use: Buying ingredient for a restaurant business

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENDIYA est composé  exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, des condiments, du manioc, de l’habillement, du poisson, des céréales, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe BENDIYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
La cliente Doussou, la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises,  compte acheter une balle de friperie avec les fournisseurs de Bamako, pour ensuite revendre aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de tubercule.
texts.en:
The BENDIYA group is composed exclusively of married women, who average 39 years of age with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell peanuts, condiments, cassava, clothing, fish, cereals, etc.. The BENDIYA group of women are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy their goods.

Member Doussou, the person sitting in the middle, intends to buy a bale of used clothing from providers in Bamako, and then resell them to customers in the village and the surrounding area.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 32,000 CFA francs which will be used for the needs of the family, and some of which will be reinvested in the tuber retail business.

loans.use: buy used clothes

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEME, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, des condiments, du manioc, de l’habillement du poisson des céréales.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
Avec ce prêt, la cliente Sourakata, la première personne à gauche dans le rang des personnes debout,  compte acheter 5 sacs d’oignon, une boîte de concentrée de tomate, 1carton de cube maggi, du poivre de l’aubergine avec les fournisseurs à Fana. Ces condiments seront vendus  aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses familiales
texts.en:
The DEME group is composed exclusively of married women who on average are 47 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
