They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell peanuts, condiments, cassava, fish, cereals, clothing. The women of the DEME group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy their goods.

Member Sourakata, the first standing on the left, plans to use this loan to buy five bags of onions, a can of tomato paste, one carton of Maggi cubes,  pepper, and eggplants from suppliers in Fana. These condiments are resold to customers in the village and the surrounding area.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs to be used for family expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan is 42 years old, lives in Divisoria and is a father to a four school aged children. He is a hardworking farmer and has been in his business for more than 10 years. Every harvest season, he is earning an income of PHP 20,000 which is just enough for their basic needs. His wife served as cook in a restaurant and he wants to help her earn a bigger income than the usual to provide for the growing needs of his children in school. 

Roldan is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy herbicides and crude oil for his farming business. In the future, he wants to see his family in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and crude oil for his farming business.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is married with one child. Bernie is 48 years old and lives in Duanguican,Tudela, Philippines.

Bernie sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, sweet candies, junk foods, seasonings, soaps, detergents, etc. 

He has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Bernie hopes to save more.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, sweet candies, soaps, detergents etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has nine children living nearby. Regina used her previous loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her business has grown and she gains more harvest. To make her farm expansion, she needs enough money to cover the costs of farm plowing and fertilization. An amount of 50,000 PHP will make it successful. She is thankful to GDMPC for giving trusts that helps improve their living situation.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm plowing and fertilization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly works hard to support her family. Gerly is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerly has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gerly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, four of whom in school, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from porticulture business. Aileen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through the past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes to sell.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons frais, de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Faïda sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente AWA, personne au milieu, compte acheter trois paniers de poisson frais à Bamako, qu’elle revend tantôt frais tantôt cuit à domicile aux clientes et clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The Faida group is made up exclusively of married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell fresh fish, condiments, and work in food preparation [for a living]. The women of the Faida group are on their fifth group loan.

Awa, the person standing in the middle, plans to buy three baskets of fresh fish in Bamako, then resell it from home, either fresh or cooked, to customers and townspeople.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA which will be used to support the needs of her family and to reinvest in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisseme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  de Badialan dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  de charbon, de céréales et d’articles divers tels les articles de poteries.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                
La cliente Chata, la personne assise à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 50 canaris, 10 jarres à Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA qui sera réutilisé dans l’activité
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made exclusively of married women, who, on average, are 46 years old and have five children. All live in traditional extended families in the Badialan neighborhood in the town of Fana, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell condiments, charcoal, cereals, and other diverse goods like pottery. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their sixth group loan, and will use it to buy the various merchandise described above.

Chata, the person seated on the right, plans to buy 50 canaris [a type of pottery container] and 10 jars in Fana. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will reuse in her business.

loans.use: to buy pottery

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
La cliente DJENEBOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche  compte acheter deux sacs d’oignon, un sac de choux pommé, dix kilogramme de poisson fumés et un sac de sel avec les revendeurs de la place, qu’elle revend sur place au marché et à domicile aux clientes et clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made exclusively of married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, in the Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell condiments or work in food preparation. The women of the Danaya group are on their fourth group loan.

Djenebou, the person standing second from the left, plans to buy two bags of onions, a sac of cauliflower, 10 kilograms of smoked fish, and a sac of salt from retailers in the area, which she will then resell in a market and from home to customers and townspeople.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support the needs of her family and to reinvest in her business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr:
Monsieur Edouard évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage plus précisément de l’embouche bovine. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin et la termine à 14h.Son activité consiste à acheter des bœufs, à les élever dans le but de les revendre dans les marchés.
Edouard habite dans un village situé à environs moins de 30km de la ville principale. Il est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de leurs principaux  besoins. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter un ou deux bœufs pour augmenter son cheptel.
Si les ventes sont bonnes, il espère pouvoir construire sa propre maison pour y abriter son foyer et les mettre dans les meilleures conditions.
texts.en:
Edouard raises and sells cows for a living. He starts his day at 6 a.m. and finishes at 2 p.m. His business consists of buying cattle and then raising them with the goal of reselling them in the markets.

Edouard lives in a village situated at least 30 kilometers from the main town. He is married and a father to a family. He is responsible for the everyday expenses and [his family's] basic needs.

He comes for the first time to seek a loan of 150,000 francs CFA in order to buy one or two cows to help expand his herd. If the sales are good, he hopes to be able to build a nice house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AWA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 4 sacs d’arachide avec les revendeurs de Dioïla, qu’elle transforme en pâte d’arachide destinée à la vente au marché et à domicile aux ménagères de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell condiments and work in food preparation [for a living]. The women of the Benkadi group are on their fifth group loan.

Awa, the first person standing on the left, plans to buy four sacs of groundnuts from sellers in Dioila that she will make into groundnut spread destined to be resold in a market and from home to different households. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA which will be used to support her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is married with three children. Franklin is 39 years old and lives in Duanguican, Philippines.

Franklin sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, sugar, seasonings, eggs, detergents, soaps,etc.

Franklin has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Franklin hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, sugar, seasonings, eggs, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is 55 years old and lives in Sto. Niño Pagadian City. She is married with seven children.

Celedonia has a tailoring business and earns eight thousand pesos only (8,000) a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting twenty thousand pesos only (20,000) to buy more textiles.

She has been a member for four years. In the future she hopes she can buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is widowed with 5 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Buenavista,Tudela, Philippines. Avelina is a farmer and grows corn crops and flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her flowers and corn crops. Avelina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Avelina hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her flowers and corn crops

loans.name: Corazón De María  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazón de María está formado por 9 mujeres que son amigas, a diario trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que le dan la oportunidad de solventar sus gastos y mejorar la economía de sus hogares, todas son personas amables y muy gentiles. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió y su geografía accidentada da lugar a bellos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, es una socia que se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Corazón de María desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha establecido mejores lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le han permitido tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

La Señora Gladys tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 22, 17 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su segundo y tercer hijo están trabajando y le ayudan económicamente, su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Gladys se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar desde hace 6 años se dedica lavar ropa ajena, también hay días que le llaman para que labore como jornalera y en casa cría cuyes y pollos. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es hacer un galpón de pollos más grande y crecer en esta actividad.
texts.en:
The group Corazón de María is made up of nine women, who are all friends. Every day they work doing different activities, which give them the opportunity to settle their expenses and improve the economy of their homes. They are all kind and courteous people. They live in the surroundings of Valle parish in Cuenca. This area has a cold climate and its uneven geography makes for beautiful landscapes to enjoy. The main economic activities are agriculture, animal breeding, and trade.

One of the members of this group is Gladys. She has been a member of Corazón de María for four years, and over this time has established better friendship ties with all her fellow members, At the same time, the loans have allowed her to have better economic stability.

Gladys is 38 years old and married. She has four children as a result of her marriage, aged 23, 22, 17, and 14 years. Her eldest daughter is married but lives in her house and shares the household expenses. Her second and third eldest children, who are sons, are working and helping her economically. Her youngest child, a daughter, is studying at a school in the city. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and the house in which they live is their own.

Gladys spends her time doing the household chores, but to contribute to her household’s economy she has been washing other people's clothes for six years. There are also days when she is called to work as a day labourer, and she breeds guinea pigs and chickens at home.

She is going to invest her new loan in purchasing chickens and animal feed.

Her goals are to make a larger chicken shed and grow in this business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is married with three children. Leila is 36 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Leila sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Leila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leila hopes to pay her children's tuition fees and also to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is married with one child. Novelyn is 24 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Philippines. 

Novelyn sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, sweet candies, junk foods, sugars, seasonings, detergents, soaps, etc. 

Novelyn has been a member of PMPC for nine months. In the future, Novelyn hope to pay her children's tuition fees and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, sweet candies, junk foods, sugars, seasonings, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is married with three children. Marrieta is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Marrieta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional materials needed to repair her house such as nails, plywood, cement, corrugated bars, plain sheets etc. and also to buy additional piglets.

Marrieta has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marrieta hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed to repair her house and to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old, single and works hard to support her parents.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Analiza is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her buy-and-sell-fish business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a forty-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a clothing business for seventeen years and with the proceeds she has been able to support her husband with family basics.

Ever-changing customer preferences and price fluctuations affect her business growth while her dream is to own a boutique.

Dorothy intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 64 years old and is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jesusa has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

Jesusa has been in this business for 11 years. Jesusa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of 9 children. She belongs to a huge family and sometimes it is very difficult for her to feed each of her children each day. She has to face a very tough time due to lack of finance.

In fact her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He does not have any other source of income except the rickshaw. He has to do a lot of hard work by day and night to get a reasonable income. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Khalida has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some do some maintenance on the engine which is needed for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Khalida is hopeful that the rainy days will come to an end one day and this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes for her family. Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on the auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en:
Ismat is a 50-years-old married man. He raises sheep and sells them for meat. Ismat has been doing this business for 10 years and is a very hard-working person. He puts a lot of effort in this activity because he wants to support his family.

Ismat keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar for the butchers and customers purchase. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. 

He has taken a loan previously and he has a good loan history. This will be his   second  loan. This time he requires 1,700 AZN to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn. Ismat is optimistic about this loan because in the autumn more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn.

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz is a 41-year-old woman married with one daughter. Aybaniz is a merchant. She sells household goods for the home.

She is a very hard-working woman. She takes care of her family. Aybaniz works the whole day. She has been in this field for ten years. Her neighbors were her first clients, and then day-by-day she expanded her business and opened a large market. Now she needs a loan of  2,000 AZN to buy more household products because people often ask her for a good she doesn't have. 

This is her 4th loan and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more household products.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children. He repairs cars in his garage and he also does welding for the maintenance of cars. He has been doing this job for more than 14 years. Asif says that it’s very hard work but to take care of his family he must work. His profit from this business is about 100 AZN a month. 

Asif wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery for his garage. With a good loan history, he has applied for his sixth loan of  1,800 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery for his garage.

loans.name: Sayad

texts.en:
Sayad is a 56-year-old married woman with three kids. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Sayad’s income is 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and she is doing it together with her husband.  Sayad keeps a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Sayad is applying for a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn. She is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep.

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.en: Doroteo is 41 years old, has two children, and lives in Divisoria. He is a hardworking farmer and he wants to provide for the needs of his family. He owns a rice field with an area of one half hectare and every harvest season he earns an average net profit of 20,000 PHP. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pesticides and seeds for his farming needs. He is looking forward to securing his family's living by maintaining his business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for his farming needs.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya is 60 years old. She operates her general store where she sells shampoo, dishwasher and detergent powders, hand soap, toothpaste, etc. She   works very hard to provide for her family. She is making good money from selling goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. Asiya is requesting an 1,800 azn loan to buy items for her store. She has a good client history and this is going to be her 5th loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is a 55 year old married man with 2 kids. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place at a central bazaar and from his home.  Mahir has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable suppliers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and are also used to make fresh punch. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

He applied for an 1,800 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover. This will be his 6th loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Mtongani-Daraja Group

texts.en:
Habiba, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three children (all girls); two are in school. For fifteen years now, Habiba has been managing her life by running different businesses: she own a beauty salon, a second-hand clothes business and she also sells water. Habiba is doing all of these activities from her house. She starts working from 6am until 9pm daily and is able to make a very good returns per month. 

This is is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Habiba will use this loan to improve her beauty salon by buying another drier and increase the clothes she has to resell. She dreams of expanding more her enterprises. 

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group "Mtongani-Daraja" which is comprised of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a salon drier and more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is 39 years old and married, with two children. He has a shop, and he has been in business for six years. He sells toys, perfumes, jewelry and other small goods. His wife also provides income for the family. She works as a cleaner at the hospital. 

Sahib needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This is his fourth loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy new items for his shop. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new items for his shop.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is a 35-year-old married father of two kids. His wife is a housewife. He is a popular merchant in his hometown, because his shop is situated in the center of town. It has already been seven years since he started selling food products. His profit from this business is about 150 AZN a month. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar, and beverages in his shop. 

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest into his business to cover his customers' demands. For this reason he is suffering. His shop is the family's main source of income, and his profit is used for their needs. Teymur would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. He applied for a 1,800 AZN loan for this purpose. He will purchase additional food products and diversify. This will be his 6th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products and diversify.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with six children. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Padian City Zamboanga del Sur Philippines.

Emma is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy more feeds and vitamins for her sow.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she wants to buy more sows to raise.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her sow.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang, Pagadian City, Zam

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 54 years old and married with three adult-aged children. He is a very caring and responsible father engaged in farming activities. He has been in this business for many years and he earns income that is just enough for the basic needs of his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of his farm. He hopes that from the generous lenders' help, his business income will grow further for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of his farming.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 45 years old and lives in Buenvavista, Pagadian City. She is married with five children. Felicisima has a business selling a banana cue to earn a living. She earns only about eight thousand pesos (8,000 PHP) each month doing this type of work. Felicisima requested a loan of only ten thousand pesos (10,000 PHP) to buy new plastic ware for stock storage and bananas.

Felicisima has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Felicisima would like to have her own stall to display her food.

loans.use: to buy new plastic ware for stock storage.

loans.name: Eutopia

texts.en: Eutopia is 59 years old and lives in Sto. Nino Pagadian City. She is married with six children. Eutopia has a dressmaking business and earns fifteen thousand pesos a month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of only fourteen thousand five hundred pesos (14,500 PHP). Eutopia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Eutopia hopes to buy a new electronic sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy one roll of fabric.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Pablita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She requested a loan to build a bigger pig tent.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to build a pig tent

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang  Pagadian City

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 40 years old and lives is Sto. Nino Pagadian City. She is married with one child.

Elisa sells beauty products and earns fifteen thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of only ten thousand pesos (10,000 PHP) to buy new beauty products. 

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Elisa hopes to have her own shop to display her beauty products.

loans.use: To buy new beauty products.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Baby Grace

texts.en:
Baby Grace is 30-years-of-age and a resident of Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with two kids. They have a little fishing business from which they earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Baby Grace and her husband work hard selling their catch in the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 14,900 loan. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Baby Grace smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is widowed with 3 children. Nemesia is 59 years old and lives in Tudela, Philippines.

Nemesia is a farmer and grows banana and corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer and other chemicals for corn-pests prevention such as flock buster, barley yellow dwarf virus, corn borers, etc.

Nemesia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Nemesia hopes to include other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other chemicals for corn-pests prevention.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married with 5 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tonggo,Tudela, Philippines.

Trinidad  is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers such as urea, potassium sulfate, ammonium nitrate, etc.

Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Trinidad hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is married with two children. Marion is 36 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines.

Marion is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to pay for additional dried copra to sell.

Marion has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marion hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to pay for additional dried copra to sell.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 55 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Pedrita has a store business selling a variety of goods. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Pedrita has  requested a loan to purchase additional inventory.

Pedrita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Pedrita would like to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. Merlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP per month. Aside from this, she also buys coconuts, bananas and charcoal to resell in bulk. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used in her farm. Recently,  Merlinda requested a loan of 60,000 PHP to purchase more charcoal, coconuts and bananas to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, coconuts and bananas to resell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. The loan also helped in the education of her child. Her income from her business assisted in their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband both work hard to provide for their family. To have additional income, she is also selling meat.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila, 47, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro, a Project Manager and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lucila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lucila dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to give a good life to her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ananbel

texts.en:
Ananbel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a movable cart of vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Ananbel has been in this business for 2 years. Ananbel earns more income from farming coconut.

Ananbel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Pemy

texts.en:
This is Pemy, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a mason and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pemy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Pemy hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Susie has been in this business for seven years. Susie earns additional income from meat-vending.

Susie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Embang

texts.en:
Embang is 53 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming/selling coconuts in the Philippines. Embang is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Embang has been farming/selling coconuts for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, fruits, etc. for her food-vending business.

Carlota has been in this business for eight years. Carlota earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Carlota has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk and fruits.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 53 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc..

Cristita has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Cristita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 47 years old and single.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, milk, coffee, cream, etc. to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food-vending.

Evangeline aspires to buy a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, milk, coffee and cream to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sayuni

texts.en: Sayuni is a hardworking married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a veterinary drug shop and her major clients are farmers in the district. Inadequate capital to meet high demand and high license fees are her major challenges. Her dream is to own a pharmacy. Sayuni intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a wholesale and retail shop in the market, and the small scale business owners are his major clients. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University. He has dreams of completing his house and expanding his business to new areas, despite challenges of stiff competition. Julius intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37-year-old married man with 3 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop, but he also practices farming in order to earn additional income. He has hardships of high competition and inadequate capital. However, his vision is to own a wholesale shop. Richard intends to use the loan to buy more general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, medicine, etc.

Dina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional wood, and other materials to use in her furniture shop.

Cresencia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wood, and other materials to use in her furniture shop.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 36-years old. Maryam and her family live in very miserable conditions.  Due to the dirty atmosphere her children often become sick. 

Her husband did not adopt any profitable profession and has been moving between jobs. He has decided to drive a rickshaw again. He has an auto rickshaw of his own but it is out of order due to problems with the engine.

Maryam requested of him that he should drive the auto rickshaw to help with the family's needs and he agreed. Therefore, she is taking a loan to encourage her husband to fix the problem with his auto rickshaw.
 
Maryam hopes that her husband will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for long time. Maryam is very thankful to the kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: with the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina; la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de verduras, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is Sabina.  She continues working with her business - a grocery store and selling vegetables.  Sabina is very responsible and persevering.  She wants to be able to continue working so as to support her family.  Sabina sells different types of products, including rice, sugar, and more.  It is with this work that she is able to help her family to get ahead.

Sabina is applying for this loan to buy merchandise such as milk, sweets, rice, and more.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as milk, sweets, rice, and more.

loans.name: La Unidad K Group

texts.es:
El señor Raul es casado, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estuduar, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negosio con poco capital y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará pra la compra de fertilizante para su cosecha de maíz, desea en el futuro contar con mayor capital para tener mejores cosechas. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y venta de comida. En la fotografía aparecen 8 integranrtes pero solo a 5 de ellos se le concedió el prestamo.
texts.en:
Raul is married. He is 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to study.  He does not have children.  Raul makes a living in agriculture, having started his business with very little capital.  He now has five years of experience and receives support from his wife.

Raul is organising a group and is applying for a loan that will be used to buy fertiliser for his corn harvest.  In the future Raul would like to have more capital so that he can have better harvests.  The other members of the group make a living growing corn and selling food.  In the photo there are eight group members but only five have been granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Farankan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Farankan, composé de femmes mariées, d’une célibataire et une veuve, ont en moyenne 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon, du lait en poudre et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Farankan sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 9 sacs de charbon de bois avec les revendeurs chaque semaine, pour ensuite revendre à domicile en détail aux clients de la ville. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de charbon de bois.
texts.en: The group Farankan, is made up of married women, one of whom is single and another a widow, who average 32 years old and 2 children each, and who live in traditional extended families in the city of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of parentage, neighborhood and friendship. They sell charcoal and powdered milk and run a restaurant. The women in the Farankan group are on their ninth group loan. The client, Fatoumata, who is the first person from the left, expects to buy 9 bags of wood charcoal from the retailers each week, to then resell it from her home at retail price to clients from her town. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family, with a part reinvested in her wood carbon sales business.

loans.use: to purchase wood coal.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is 57 years old and married. She runs a market in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store. This stock includes soft drinks, alcoholic drinks (beer), cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, noodles, water, slippers, fish, biscuits and rice. She is making good money from selling these goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. 

Almaz is living in a town near the school. Her store is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy goods. She has a very simple house because her husband was a farmer and had animals such as horses, buffalo and chickens. Now she needs a loan 2,000 azn, and this is going to be her 6th loan. Almaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy stock to keep in her store.

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is a young 22-year-old client. He is living with his parents in his town. He sells food products like cakes, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 2 years. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

Orxan is now requesting 1,800 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He has a good loan history. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en: Tanzila is 42 years old. She operates her general store where she sells shampoo, dishwasher and detergent powders, hand soap, toothpaste, etc. She   works very hard to provide for her family. She is making good money from selling goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. Tanzila is requesting an 1,800 azn loan to buy items for her store. She has a good client history and this is going to be her 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 42-year-old mother of two kids. She sells stationery in her shop. She has selling experience from the past 10 years. Previously she used to sell different products in her shop, but now she is focused only on selling items for schoolchildren and students. Gulzar is running the business with the support of her husband. She has a shop in the central bazaar. 

She has good sales due to her location near schools and other educational centers. Soon, in September when schools open, more school items are going to be purchased. She has taken 3 loans from AqroInvest previously. Now she requires a loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money she plans to purchase more items for the new semester, when pupils and students return to attend schools and colleges.

loans.use: to purchase more items for the new semester.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan, 36 years old, is the married mother of seven children. She has lived in the countryside her whole life, where she learned to work in agriculture. She owns farmland of around one and one-half hectare, on which she grows seasonal rice crops. The harvest is collected for basic subsistence and sold in the local marketplace where she lives. This work is the main source of income for her family, with which she provides for all of the household's basic needs.

Currently, she needs to hire a few laborers to plow and transplant her rice crops, but she has inadequate money to make it possible. That’s why she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from HKL. In this way she will be able to hire suitable workers to accomplish her farm tasks on time. Through her effort and loan support, she hopes to have a more productive harvest than in prior years. This will help her to increase her earnings. Yan thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to hire a few laborers to plow and transplant her rice crops.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa tiene 42 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. Ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y para pagar a los peones, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Nicolasa is 42 years old and lives in the Chicchicmarca community in the Colquepata district of the Paucartabmo province in the Cusco department, Peru. Her main source of work is agriculture and Nicolasa grows wheat, barley, potatoes, vegetables, and other items.  She has been working in this business for some years and it is going very well.  Nicolasa is a responsible person and so was invited to be a part of the "Apu Asangani" communal bank.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy manure and to pay labourers.  Nicolasa is grateful for and understands the value of this loan. She promises to be very responsible with her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Laureana tiene 45 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Laureana is 45 years old and lives in the Chicchicmarca community in the Colquepata district of the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.  Laureana's main source of work is agriculture - she grows wheat, barley, potatoes, vegetables, and other items.  She has had the business for some years and it is going well thanks to her determination.  Laureana is a responsible person and so she was invited to be a part of the "Apu Asangani" communal bank.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertlisers.  Laureana is grateful for and knows the value of this loan.  She promises to be responsible with her monthly repayments,

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en: Benjie is 28 years old, married, and a father of two school-aged children. As a farmer, he wants his family to live well in accordance with his dreams. That is why he is doing his best to maintain his farming business. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizer for the business. As a father, he also wants to make sure that his two children will someday finish their college education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 21 years old, and lives with John, her husband and they have two children. She is raising hogs to generate income and to help sustain her family's daily needs. She needs to raise healthier hogs in order to sell them at a higher cost. 

Jinky has insufficient funds now and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed for her hogs. This will help improve the nutrition of her raised hogs. If she can be a good livestock raiser, she will somehow be able to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 38 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Juliet has a pig raising business and earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for feed and vitamins. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Juliet hopes to have more savings available for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 39 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 10 children. Rosalyn works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to pay for a fish net and other fishing materials. Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a fish net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in South Mapang, Rizal. Marlyn has a shop where she sells motor spare parts. She has had this business for 6 years, earning a monthly income of 5,600 PHP. Marlyn has a new loan to purchase 10 boxes of new inventory to sell. Marlyn has been a Paglaum MPC  member since January 19, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of assorted motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional computer parts and supplies for her computer shop. Her income from the loan also helped in the education of her child and in their everyday expenses.She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Miguela dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will always be happy and well. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she draws strength from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Nety

texts.en:
Nety is 62 years old. She is married and blessed with one kid. She lives in Tugas, Baliangao. Nety is a businesswoman having a shop that sells assorted groceries (such as noodles, rice, soap etc.). She has been in this kind of business for more than 15 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,600. 

Nety has requested a new loan to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. Nety has been a Paglaum MPC member since December 9, 2010.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children. Her business income assisted in covering their everyday expenses at home. She has been in this business for six years now. She also has a farm for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elvie hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to save more for their future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 41-year-old married woman living with her spouse and 5 children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and sells fruit on a cart in their hometown. He goes to the fruit market on a daily basis early in the morning to buy fresh seasonal fruit such as mangoes, bananas, peaches, apples, grapes, etc. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of the fruit he sells. 

He has been selling fruit for many years. As a result, he understands his customers' preferences and the people's demands. Now he has grown old and cannot walk as much, so he rents a shop to continue his fruit selling business. However, his remaining funds do not allow him to buy fruit to sell. Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan so that her husband can buy more fruit, especially seasonal fruit. 

This is Kishwar's first loan. She promises that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to get a larger loan in the future. Kishwar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Kishwar is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rosedelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosedelma works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a furniture making business.  Rosedelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. for her bread production business.

Rosedelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been doing embroidery work using a machine at home for the past two years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work in his shop but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. This is why he brings some embroidery work home for her to do. She helps her husband in his work as well as she sells stitched embroidery in her town. 

By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan to purchase a machine for embroidery. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children. 

Shabana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for embroidery work.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 49 years old and single with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Eulalia is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her vegetable business.

Estela has been in this business for six years. Estela earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Estela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rubilita

texts.en:
Rubilita is a hog raiser at Annafunan. She cleans her pigpen every day. From this, she is able to maintain good sanitation in her business. 

She has been in her business over a year now and earns PHP 2,000 on each hog when disposed. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. 

She is now asking a loan to buy medicines and feed for her hogs. She hopes to keep ensuring good growth and nutrition to her raised hogs so that she can sell them at a higher price. 

She hopes to become successful in her business, and she will continue provide her children's needs in their pursuit of studies.

loans.use: to buy medicines and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 54 years old, married to Abraham, and they have four children. Julie is raising hogs to sell for a living. She would like to become a successful hog grower someday, thus, Julie is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve her livestock business. 

She will buy feed and vaccines for the growth and sustenance of her hogs. She promises to pay back her loan in full if it is approved. The way it will be given will make it easy for her.

loans.use: buy feed and vaccines for the growth and sustenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo is a loving mother of four. She is a widowed woman. Her family lives at Annafunan and she raises hogs and sells them to sustain their daily living. Amparo earns an income of 3,000 PHP for each hog sale. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for the hogs she raises. Amparo hopes to keep raising hogs and someday become a successful hog raiser in her village.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the hogs she raises.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, who are still attending school. His wife works as a school teacher. As for him, he is an upholsterer working in this type of business for the past 10 years. He is particularly specialized in renewing the furniture of a car. He possesses his own shop and has one part timer assisting him to accomplish the work. 

Today Elias is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase leather. He states that customers insist on having leather furniture in their car since it’s more classy and feasible. Elias is very optimistic, ambitious and always seeks the best; and this is the reason of why he is doing a great effort in his professional career to progress, increase his financials and improve his family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase leather.

loans.name: Pel

texts.en:
Pel, 46, is in a common-law marriage and the mother of an adult child.  She has been a farmer for about 30 years. Her living is based on agriculture, so she works hard all day long at her rice paddy to provide enough for her family. She has committed herself to provide her child better opportunities of education however hard she has to work. Her child also helps her in all the farming activities such as irrigation, maintenance, weeding, and other tasks.

Currently she has requested a loan to buy rice to secure enough food for her family as her grains of rice in her barn have just been finished. Her goals for the future are to expand her land, plant a variety of grains to help her business grow, improve her income for her family, and, above all, earn income to give her child a better education. She thanks lenders for constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy rice for her family to eat.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer is 54 years old, and he has five children. He grows hogs and sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired weight. He hopes to continue growing healthy hogs. 

He is now asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for hogs. He promises to pay back the loan when it's granted on time and in full. 

Someday, Eliezer would like to grow more hogs and improve his income for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. His wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. He has been working as a truck driver at a mining company for one year. The house they live in has been deteriorating and recently he began repairing it, but due to the lack of finance, he didn't finish. So he is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to purchase bricks, cement, windows and fiberglass. 

After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they won't burn much coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, windows and fiberglass.

loans.name: Louel

texts.en:
Louel resides at Gata Daku, Clarin. He has earned his living by providing transportation services for more than three years. With this money, he provides for the needs of his child. He gets an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. Aside from this, he also works as a security guard in a private company to make extra income. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to repair his vehicle. 

Now Louel is borrowing 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his general living.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is from the village of Gata Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Gil owns and operates a business venture providing motor transportation services. Aside from this, he also works as a security guard of a private company.  

Gil has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to repair his vehicle. Recently, Gil requested a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires. He plans to use the generated profit from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen prepares and sells barbecue to earn a living. She lives with her husband and child in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. 

Bebialen used her previous loan to purchase ingredients, and she has successfully repaid it. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of PHP 36,000 to purchase more raw ingredients and pots for her business.

She wants to improve her business and use the profit to secure a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients and pots

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy. She previously accessed an 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dorcy dreams that both her business and spiritual life will grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
